intro: Clavija pungens, commonly known as the spiked clavija, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
